intro: Zigadenus longus, commonly known as the long-stemmed death bloom, is a toxic plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Melanthiaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. The plant contains potent alkaloids, including cyclopamine, which can be lethal to humans and animals if ingested. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Due to its toxicity, it is important to avoid contact or consumption of any part of this plant.
